title: How do sickness days vary by job type?
analysis_commentary: The job group that takes the most (0) sickness days is direct care where 40.6% had no sick days in 2013, 1.8 percentage points lower than the average for all job roles. The direct group also had a slightly larger percentage of staff taking '10.1 to 20' sickness days; this was 8.6% in 2013 compared to 6.1% for managers, supervisors. This perhaps indicates that job roles which are directly involved in providing care and support, on average take more sickness days than those not directly involved.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Social Services: Staff of Social Services Departments
